sen.j: 織田 信良（おだ のぶよし、1584年（天正12年） - 1626年7月10日（寛永3年5月17日 (旧暦)））は、安土桃山時代、江戸時代の武将、大名。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi ODA (1584 - July 10, 1626) was a military commander and daimyo (feudal lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama and Edo periods.
Nobuyoshi ODA (1584 - July 10, 1626) was a military commander and daimyo (feudal lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama and Edo periods.
Nobuyoshi ODA (1584 - July 10, 1626) was a military commander and daimyo (feudal lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama and Edo periods.

sen.j: 上野国小幡藩の初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the first domain lord of Obata domain in Kozuke Province.
He was the first domain lord of the Obata domain in Kozuke Province.
He was the first domain lord of the Obata domain in Kozuke Province.

sen.j: 織田信雄の四男。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi was the fourth son of Nobukatsu ODA.
Nobuyoshi was the fourth son of Nobukatsu ODA.
Nobuyoshi was the fourth son of Nobukatsu ODA.

sen.j: 母は木造具政の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Tomomasa KOZUKURI.
His mother was a daughter of Tomomasa KOZUKURI.
His mother was a daughter of Tomomasa KOZUKURI.

sen.j: 幼名は勝法師。
sen.e: His childhood name was Shohoshi.
His childhood name was Shohoshi.
His childhood name was Shohoshi.

sen.j: 諱は信良。
sen.e: His imina (personal name) was Nobuyoshi.
His imina (personal name) was Nobuyoshi.
His imina (personal name) was Nobuyoshi.

sen.j: 仮名 (通称)は因幡国守、兵部少輔。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi's kemyo (assumed name) was Inaba no kuni no kami (Governor of Inaba Province), Hyobushoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of Military).
Nobuyoshi's kemyo (assumed name) was Inaba no kuni no kami (Governor of Inaba Province), Hyobushoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of Military).
Nobuyoshi's kemyo (assumed name) was Inaba no kuni no kami (Governor of Inaba Province), Hyobushoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of Military).

sen.j: 官位は従五位上侍従、従四位上左少将。
sen.e: His official court rank was Jugoinojo jiju (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade Chamberlain) and Juyon-inojo sashosho (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade Minor Captain).
His official court rank was Jugoinojo jiju (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade Chamberlain) and Juyon-inojo sashosho (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade Minor Captain).
His official court rank was Jugoinojo jiju (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade Chamberlain) and Jushiinojo sashosho (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade Minor Captain).

sen.j: 正室は大納言・久我通堅の三男下津俸庵の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was a daughter of Bouan SHIMOZU who was the third son of Michikata KOGA, Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
His lawful wife was a daughter of Bouan SHIMOZU, who was the third son of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Michikata KOGA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Bouan SHIMOZU, who was the third son of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Michikata KOGA.

sen.j: 子女は織田信昌（次男）、長女光松院（徳川忠長正室）、次女（稲葉信通正室）、三女（稲葉信通継室）ら2男3女。
sen.e: He had two sons and three daughters, including Nobumasa ODA (the second son), the eldest daughter, Koshoin (lawful wife of Tadanaga TOKUGAWA), the second daughter (lawful wife of Nobumichi INABA), and the third daughter (second wife of Nobumichi INABA).

He had two sons and three daughters, including Nobumasa ODA (the second son), the eldest daughter, Koshoin (lawful wife of Tadanaga TOKUGAWA), the second daughter (lawful wife of Nobumichi INABA), and the third daughter (second wife of Nobumichi INABA).

He had two sons and three daughters, including Nobumasa ODA (the second son), the eldest daughter, Koshoin (lawful wife of Tadanaga TOKUGAWA), the second daughter (lawful wife of Nobumichi INABA), and the third daughter (second wife of Nobumichi INABA).

sen.j: 天正12年（1584年）、伊勢国で誕生。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi ODA was born in Ise Province in 1584.
Nobuyoshi ODA was born in Ise Province in 1584.
Nobuyoshi ODA was born in Ise Province in 1584.

sen.j: 生母木造氏は、父信雄の継室であるとされている。
sen.e: It is said that his real mother, a Kozukuri clan, was the second wife of his father, Nobukatsu.
It is said that his real mother, who was from the Kozukuri clan, was the second wife of his father, Nobukatsu.
It is said that his real mother, who was from the Kozukuri clan, was the second wife of his father, Nobukatsu.

sen.j: しかし、信良の出生時に父信雄の正室北畠氏は存命している。
sen.e: However, the lawful wife of his father, a Kitabatake clan, was alive when Nobuyoshi was born.
However, the lawful wife of his father, who was from the Kitabatake clan, was alive when Nobuyoshi was born.
However, the lawful wife of his father, who was from the Kitabatake clan, was alive when Nobuyoshi was born.

sen.j: おそらく、もともと生母木造氏は側室であったものの、正室北畠氏の死亡後に継室扱いされたのであろう。
sen.e: It is probable that his real mother was Nobukatsu's concubine but treated as the second wife after the death of the lawful wife.
It is possible that his real mother was Nobukatsu's concubine, but was treated as the second wife after the death of the lawful wife.
It is possible that his real mother was Nobukatsu's concubine, but was treated as the second wife after the death of the lawful wife.

sen.j: 一説には、父信雄の改易後、一時的に細川忠興のもとに身を寄せたという。
sen.e: According to one theory, Nobuyoshi temporarily stayed with Tadaoki HOSOKAWA after the rank of Nobukatsu, his father, was changed.
According to one theory, Nobuyoshi temporarily stayed with Tadaoki HOSOKAWA after the rank of his father Nobukatsu was changed.
According to one theory, Nobuyoshi temporarily stayed with Tadaoki HOSOKAWA after the rank of his father Nobukatsu was changed.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)年間、父信雄から上野国甘楽郡などで2万石を分け与えられる。
sen.e: Twenty thousands goku (crop yields), such as those of Kanra District in Kozuke Province, was distributed to Nobuyoshi by Nobukatsu, his father, in the Genna era (1615 - 1623).
Twenty thousands goku (crop yields), such as those of Kanra District in Kozuke Province, was distributed to Nobuyoshi by his father Nobukatsu in the Genna era (1615 - 1623).
20,000 koku (crop yields), such as those of Kanra District in Kozuke Province, was distributed to Nobuyoshi by his father Nobukatsu in the Genna era (1615 - 1623).
sen.cmt: Twenty thousands gokuを20,000 kokuに変更しました。

sen.j: はじめは甘楽郡福島村に陣屋を構え、後に小幡村に移転し、城下町や灌漑用水設備の整備など、藩政の基礎固めに努めた。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi first established Jin-ya (regional government office) in Fukushima village of Kanra district, and later moved to Obata village where he made efforts to solidify the foundation for domain duties such as improvement of a castle town and the irrigation water system.

Nobuyoshi first established the Jin-ya (regional government office) in Fukushima village of Kanra district, and later moved to Obata village where he made efforts to solidify the foundation for domain duties such as the improvement of thecastle town and the irrigation system.

Nobuyoshi first established the Jin-ya (regional government office) in Fukushima village of Kanra district, and later moved to Obata village where he made efforts to solidify the foundation for domain duties such as the improvement of the castle town and the irrigation system.
sen.cmt: theとcastleの間にスペースを挿入しました。

sen.j: 事実上、父信雄は隠居したものと思われる。
sen.e: It seems that Nobukatsu, his father, virtually retired.
It is believed that his father Nobukatsu had already retired.
It is believed that his father Nobukatsu had already retired.

sen.j: 織田秀雄・高雄らの兄は既に亡くなっていたようである。
sen.e: It is probable that his older brothers such as Hidekatsu and Takakatsu ODA were already dead.
And it is believed that his older brothers such as Hidekatsu and Takakatsu ODA were already dead.
And it is believed that his older brothers such as Hidekatsu and Takakatsu ODA were already dead.

sen.j: なお、父信雄は大和国宇陀郡などで3万1,200石を領有し、京都で暮らした。
sen.e: Moreover, Nobukatsu, his father, lived in Kyoto with possession of thirty thousands and twelve hundreds goku in Uda district of Yamato Province and other places.
His father Nobukatsu had lived in Kyoto with possession of 31,200 goku in the Uda district of Yamato Province among other places.
His father Nobukatsu had lived in Kyoto with possession of 31,200 koku in the Uda district of Yamato Province among other places.

sen.j: 後にこの隠居料をめぐり、信良の息子織田信昌と弟織田高長の間で相続争いが起きた。
sen.e: Later, Nobumasa ODA, Nobuyoshi's son, fought with Takanaga ODA, his younger brother, over this retirement stipend.
Later, Nobumasa ODA, Nobuyoshi's son, fought with Takanaga ODA, his younger brother, over this inheritance.
Later, Nobumasa ODA, Nobuyoshi's son, fought with Takanaga ODA, his younger brother, over this inheritance.

sen.j: 元和2年10月（1616年）、従五位上侍従に叙任。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi was appointed to Jugoinojo jiju in 1616.
Nobuyoshi was appointed to Jugoinojo jiju in 1616.
Nobuyoshi was appointed to Jugoinojo jiju in November 1616.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 元和3年（1617年）以降、領地を分け与えられたと考えられる。
sen.e: It is considered that a territory was distributed to him in 1617 onwards.
It is considered that some territory was allocated to him from 1617 and onwards.
It is considered that some territory was allocated to him from 1617 and onwards.

sen.j: 元和9年（1623年）12月、従四位上左少将に昇進する。
sen.e: He was promoted to Juyon-inojo sashosho in December, 1623.
He was promoted to Juyon-inojo sashosho in December, 1623.
He was promoted to Jushiinojo sashosho in January, 1624.
sen.cmt: Juyon-inojoをJushiinojoに変更しました。グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: なお、同年11月7日、信良の長女が徳川秀忠の三男・忠長と結婚している。
sen.e: Moreover, the eldest daughter of Nobuyoshi married with Tadanaga, the third son of Hidetada TOKUGAWA, in November 7 of the same year.
Also, the eldest daughter of Nobuyoshi became married to Tadanaga, the third son of Hidetada TOKUGAWA, in November 7 of the same year.
Also, the eldest daughter of Nobuyoshi got married to Tadanaga, the third son of Hidetada TOKUGAWA, in December 28 of the same year.
sen.cmt: becameをgotに変更しました。グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 官位の高さは、織田家の嫡流であること、徳川家の外戚であることなどを考えられる。
sen.e: For height of Nobuyoshi's official court rank, it is considered that he belonged to the main branch of the ODA family, he was the maternal relative of the TOKUGAWA family, and other things.
It is believed that the high level of Nobuyoshi's official court rank depended on his belonging to the main branch of the ODA family, and that he was a maternal relative of the TOKUGAWA family.
It is believed that the high level of Nobuyoshi's official court rank depended on his belonging to the main branch of the ODA family, and that he was a maternal relative of the TOKUGAWA family.

sen.j: その後、小幡藩織田家は明和事件に巻き込まれるまで、四品以上に昇進する大名家一覧の待遇を受けた。
sen.e: Later, until getting involved with the Meiwa Incident, the ODA family in Obata Province was treated as the list of daimyo families to be promoted to Shihon (Fourth Rank) or more.
sen.cmt: 「一覧の待遇を受けた」という日本語は不自然ですが、そのとおりに訳出しました。（ちなみに、ウィキペディア原文では「国主格の待遇を受けた」です。その「国主格」をクリックすると、「四品以上に昇進する大名家一覧」のページへ飛びます。）
sen.e: Until getting involved with the Meiwa Incident, the ODA family in Obata Province was treated as one of the daimyo families who can be promoted to Shihon (Fourth Rank) or higher.
Until getting involved with the Meiwa Incident, the ODA family in Obata Province was treated as one of the daimyo families who can be promoted to Shihon (Fourth Rank) or higher.

sen.j: なお、宇陀松山藩織田家も国主格の待遇を受けた。
sen.e: Moreover, the ODA family in the Uda-Matsuyama domain was also treated as the status of Kokushu (landed daimyo).
The ODA family in the Uda-Matsuyama domain was also treated with the status of Kokushu (landed daimyo).
The ODA family in the Uda-Matsuyama domain was also treated with the status of Kokushu (landed daimyo).

sen.j: 元和8年（1622年）1月5日、茶会を催し、佐竹義宣 (右京大夫)らを招く。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi held a tea ceremony and invited Yoshinobu SATAKE (Ukyo no Daibu, Minister of the Kyoto Right Administration Office) and others in January 5, 1622.
Nobuyoshi held a tea ceremony and invited Yoshinobu SATAKE (Ukyo no Daibu, Minister of the Kyoto Right Administration Office) and others in January 5, 1622.
Nobuyoshi held a tea ceremony and invited Yoshinobu SATAKE (Ukyo no Daibu, Minister of the Kyoto Right Administration Office) and others in February 15, 1622.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 元和9年（1623年）5月、徳川秀忠に従って上洛する。
sen.e: He went up to Kyoto following Hidetada TOKUGAWA in May, 1623.
He visited to Kyoto under the orders of Hidetada TOKUGAWA in May, 1623.
He visited to Kyoto under the orders of Hidetada TOKUGAWA in May, 1623.

sen.j: 元和10年（1624年）1月2日、伊達政宗・毛利秀元らとともに江戸城西丸の徳川家光のもとに出仕する。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi served Iemitsu TOKUGAWA in Nishimaru of the Edo Castle with Masamune DATE, Hidemoto MORI, and others in January 2, 1624.
Nobuyoshi served Iemitsu TOKUGAWA in Nishimaru of the Edo Castle with Masamune DATE, Hidemoto MORI, and others in January 2, 1624.
Nobuyoshi served Iemitsu TOKUGAWA in Nishimaru of the Edo Castle with Masamune DATE, Hidemoto MORI, and others in February 20, 1624.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 同月、徳川秀忠の朝廷に対する使者として上洛する。
sen.e: In the same month, he went up to Kyoto as an envoy to the Imperial Court dispatched by Hidetada TOKUGAWA.
In the same month, he went to Kyoto as an envoy to the Imperial Court dispatched by Hidetada TOKUGAWA.
In the same month, he went to Kyoto as an envoy to the Imperial Court dispatched by Hidetada TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 寛永3年（1626年）5月17日、父に先立って43歳で死去し、家督は次男・信昌が継いだ。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi died at the age of forty-three in May 17, 1626, before his father and Nobumasa, his second son, inherited the family estate.
Nobuyoshi passed away at the age of 43 in May 17, 1626, ahead of his father, and his second son Nobumasa inherited the family estate.
Nobuyoshi passed away at the age of 43 in July 10, 1626, ahead of his father, and his second son Nobumasa inherited the family estate.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 墓所は小幡の宝積寺、後に崇福寺に改葬。
sen.e: His graveyard was Hoshaku-ji Temple in Obata and later reburied in Sofuku-ji Temple.
His graveyard was located in Hoshaku-ji Temple in Obata, but was later transferred to Sofuku-ji Temple.
His graveyard was located in Hoshaku-ji Temple in Obata, but was later transferred to Sofuku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 法号は心芳院松岩浄青。
sen.e: His Buddhist name was Shinpoin Shogan Josei.
His Buddhist name was Shinpoin Shogan Josei.
His Buddhist name was Shinpoin Shogan Josei.
